name: Albert Einstein
bio: Albert Einstein was a renowned physicist known for his theory of relativity. He made significant contributions to our understanding of the universe.

name: Marie Curie
bio: Marie Curie was a pioneering scientist in the field of radioactivity. Her groundbreaking research paved the way for important advancements in science and medicine.
achievements: Nobel Prizes in Physics (1903) and Chemistry (1911)

name: Nelson Mandela
bio: Nelson Mandela played a key role in ending apartheid and became the first black president of South Africa. His tireless efforts for justice and equality inspired the world.

name: Coco Chanel
bio: Coco Chanel revolutionized women's fashion with her elegant and timeless designs. Her influence on style continues to be felt to this day.

name: Mahatma Gandhi
bio: Mahatma Gandhi led India to independence through nonviolent civil disobedience. His principles of truth and nonviolence remain powerful beacons for justice.

name: Leonardo da Vinci
bio: Leonardo da Vinci was a painter, scientist, and inventor known for his diverse talents. His works continue to captivate and inspire people around the world.

name: Amelia Earhart
bio: Amelia Earhart was a pioneering aviator and the first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean. Her courage and determination shattered gender barriers in aviation.
achievements: First woman to fly solo across the Atlantic

name: Winston Churchill
bio: Winston Churchill was the British Prime Minister during World War II and a skilled orator. His leadership and eloquence rallied the nation in its darkest hours.
achievements: Led Britain during World War II

name: Frida Kahlo
bio: Frida Kahlo's artwork was known for its unique style and exploration of identity. Her powerful self-portraits and emotional depth continue to captivate art lovers.

name: Steve Jobs
bio: Steve Jobs co-founded Apple Inc. and played a key role in the development of personal computers and technology. His vision transformed the way we interact with technology.
